page.title: 03Buildings in Melchbourne
page.content: Melchbourne Park was built in 162O and refaced in 1741. It is red brick with stone dressing under a slated roof.It is set in beautiful parkland with two lakes and is surrounded by deciduous woodland.It has been converted into ten flats. Hillands Cottage was originally two cottages built in 17th Century of colour washed plaster on a timber frame, with a thatched roof. The Old School House was originally a school built by Lord St.John in 1857. The brickwork is an attractive chequered design with stone dressings. A row of eight cottages built in 18th Century of cob construction. They are colourwashed pebbledash under one thatched roof.An adjacent identical row was burnt down twenty five years ago.
